 Thanks for all the information.It was of great help.

  "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...> wrote: Your CLASSPATH is incorrect and your command is incorrect. MoneyTest is
in a package, therefore you must specify the fully-qualified class name
junit.samples.money.MoneyTest to the TestRunner. Your CLASSPATH must
point to the folder containing the folder junit\samples\money. You must
have been doing something different when you ran the Swing TestRunner,
because if you did not specify the fully-qualified class name, no test
runner would work.

Please review a Java tutorial about how the JVM searches for classes in
its CLASSPATH, because this is not a JUnit problem, per se.

Good luck.

*********** REPLY SEPARATOR  ***********

On 2002-07-22 at 19:25 sreenivasa reddy wrote:

>Hello,
>
>I'm using JSDK 1.4 and Junit 3.7 on Win 98. And When I try to run
>junit.textui.TestRunner from the command prompt, I'm getting an
Exception
>in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: MoneyTest (wrong
name:
>junit/samples/money/MoneyTest). 
>
>Whereas, junit.swingui.TestRunner is working fine.
>
>I've checked the CLASSPATH and it is set to junit/samples/ and
>junit/samples/money and junit/junit.jar. I am unable to reason, why
I'm
>facing this problem.
>
>Can anyone of you, please help me out.
>
>
>Thanks,
>
>Sreenivas
>
